sac

Interface State

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<State>, Graphvizable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    GameState, GraphState
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Checkers, GameStateImpl, GraphStateImpl, HelloWorldGameState, HelloWorldGraphState, NimState, PackingState, PackingStateFullCuts, SlidingPuzzle, StateImpl, Sudoku, TravelingSalesmanProblem

    public interface State
extends java.lang.Comparable<State>, Graphvizable
    An abstract state in some search problem, common for graphs and game trees.
    Author:
    Przemysław Klęsk (wi.zut.edu.pl), Marcin Korzeń (wi.zut.edu.pl)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<? extends State> generateChildren()
      Generates and returns children (descendants) for this state.
      java.util.List<? extends State> getChildren()
      Returns the list of references to children (descendants) of this state.
      double getDepth()
      Returns the depth of this state (number of parent states above it)
      double getH()
      Returns the value of heuristics for this state.
      Identifier getIdentifier()
      Returns the identifier for this state.
      java.lang.String getMoveName()
      Returns the name of the move (or operation) that led to generating this state.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getMovesAlongPath()
      Returns a sequence of move names indicating how this state was reached from the initial state.
      State getParent()
      Returns the reference to this state's parent.
      java.util.List<? extends State> getPath()
      Returns the path for this state (reversed list of references to successive parents upwards).
      void refresh()
      Forces a refresh of both the identifier and the heuristics for this state.
      void refreshH()
      Forces a refresh of the heuristics value (in case some manipulation or move on this state has been made).
      void refreshIdentifier()
      Forces a refresh on identifier.
      void setDepth(double depth)
      Sets depth of this state.
      void setH(java.lang.Double h)
      Explicitly sets the value of heuristics for this state.
      void setMoveName(java.lang.String moveName)
      Sets the name of the move (or operation) that led to generating this state.
      void setParent(State parent)
      Sets reference to parent state for this state.

    • Method Detail

      • getIdentifier

        Identifier getIdentifier()
        Returns the identifier for this state.
        Returns:
        identifier

      • refreshIdentifier

        void refreshIdentifier()
        Forces a refresh on identifier. This method may be useful when in the runtime a change is made on the type of identifiers (static field of Identifier class). Before executing a search, any search algorithm should refresh the identifier of the initial state.

      • getParent

        State getParent()
        Returns the reference to this state's parent.
        Returns:
        parent of this state

      • setParent

        void setParent(State parent)
        Sets reference to parent state for this state.
        Parameters:
        parent - reference to parent

      • getChildren

        java.util.List<? extends State> getChildren()
        Returns the list of references to children (descendants) of this state.
        Returns:
        list of references to children

      • getDepth

        double getDepth()
        Returns the depth of this state (number of parent states above it)
        Returns:
        depth of this state

      • setDepth

        void setDepth(double depth)
        Sets depth of this state.
        Parameters:
        depth - to be set

      • getPath

        java.util.List<? extends State> getPath()
        Returns the path for this state (reversed list of references to successive parents upwards).
        Returns:
        path

      • getMovesAlongPath

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getMovesAlongPath()
        Returns a sequence of move names indicating how this state was reached from the initial state.
        Returns:
        sequence of move names

      • generateChildren

        java.util.List<? extends State> generateChildren()
        Generates and returns children (descendants) for this state. This method is meant to be implemented by user and called by search algorithms.
        Returns:
        generated children

      • getH

        double getH()
        Returns the value of heuristics for this state. For graph searches, heuristics is an estimated distance from this state to the goal state. For game tree searches heuristics is an evaluation of the game position represented by this state (positive values indicate an advantage of the maximizing player, negative values indicate an advantege of the minimizing player).
        Returns:
        value of heuristics for this state

      • setH

        void setH(java.lang.Double h)
        Explicitly sets the value of heuristics for this state. This method is meant only for special purposes i.e. to be called only from within the SaC API. E.g. in game searches, it is necessary to introduce a grading of infinite (win) values of heuristics. Thus, the user should typically use only getH() and refresh() methods.
        Parameters:
        h - value of heuristics to be set

      • refreshH

        void refreshH()
        Forces a refresh of the heuristics value (in case some manipulation or move on this state has been made).

      • getMoveName

        java.lang.String getMoveName()
        Returns the name of the move (or operation) that led to generating this state.
        Returns:
        name of the move that led to generating this state.

      • setMoveName

        void setMoveName(java.lang.String moveName)
        Sets the name of the move (or operation) that led to generating this state.
        Parameters:
        moveName - move name to be set

      • refresh

        void refresh()
        Forces a refresh of both the identifier and the heuristics for this state.
